instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330B: What is 820-3330B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message: There is sound but there isn't video. On 3rd and 4th legs of J9000, there were short circuits, I cleaned them and made another path. On 4th leg there is 3.3 volts but there isn't any on 2nd & 3rd. So, I backtracked and checked <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. On its 2nd & 3rd legs, there are 3.3 volts but there is no voltage on <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>. On the same path there is no voltage on first leg of <RESISTOR>R9678</RESISTOR>. In this case, should I replace <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
No matter problem found on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, you need to resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded solder.
Is a preventive measure, which can also be related with your particular problem.

Do you get external video?

Check <RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR>/11, their traces and solders.
Post voltage and diode mode to ground at CLK/DATA lines.
Be sure video connector and cable are good; test with another LCD assembly.

BTW, use "pin" instead of "leg" for electronic components...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage

[URL]https://realmacmods.com/macbook-2011-radeon-gpu-disable/[/URL]  "3 months ago"

check it <RESISTOR>R9010</RESISTOR>/11 No problem 100K
CLK/DATA = 0,517
I tried the screen on another device it works


We always say leg in Turkey, but I will say pin for you.  :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Does that mod survive to PRAM reset?

PCH needs to talk first with LCD through DDC bus, via <CHIP>U9270</CHIP>.
Check if that MUX chip is correctly controlled.

pins 5 & 6. no voltage  (lcd plugged in)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Pins 5/12 must be high, when iGPU enabled.
Of course 6/13 must be low at same time; discrete GPU disabled.
GMUX (<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>) is still in place?

BTW, no reason to measure video/backlight signals without LCD connected!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message: GMUX (<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>) is still in place? Yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Then you have a problem in that area.
GMUX controlls DDC MUX.
Re-check all work done for GPU disable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message: Before I made uma, device was turning on with a green screen. After the uma, there was no problem, it turned on. But,  a piece of solder stuck on lcd pins and it caused it to short circuit, so I get no image now. SMC reset is enough to cancel UMA. I cancelled it, there are 3.3 volts on the 6th pin of <CHIP>U9270</CHIP> but still I get no image, no light, nothing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Pin 6 high means now GPU is enabled.
So there is a GPU related issue.
What mod did you use to disable GPU?

When UMA was cancelled, it turned on with a green screen as I stated but, I don't think GPU is the problem right now because there is no image, nothing. Before, GPU was offline and there was no image again. I cancelled UMA as you instructed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
That LCD connector MUST be changed.
Video cable could be damaged too, inspect it with microscope.
If GPU is still in use, check for external video.

Check L9010/11 continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Check traces from <CHIP>U9270</CHIP> to J9000.
Post <CHIP>U9270</CHIP> voltages, with internal LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Check traces from <CHIP>U9270</CHIP> to J9000. = I checked the line it's ok

<CHIP>U9270</CHIP>
pin1 = 3.3 Volt
pin2&3 = 3.3 Volt
pin4 = 3.3 Volt
pin5&12 = No Voltage
pin6&13 = 3.3 Volt
pin7 = gnd
pin8 = 3.3 volt
pin9&10 = 3.3 volt
pin 11 = 3.3 volt
pin14 = 3.3 Volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
Looks like discrete graphics is selected.
You may have a problem with GMUX (<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>), or bad communication with internal LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No İmage
threads.message:
You may have problems with LCD connector, or its traces.
Did you tested with compatible good LCD assembly for sure?
